SENT.plain: To diagnose recurrent colorectal cancer is an urgent problem of oncoproctology
Eighty patients with suspected recurrent colon tumor were examined
All the patients underwent irrigoscopy, colonoscopy, magnetic resonance imaging of the abdomen and small pelvis
The major magnetic resonance symptoms of recurrent colon tumors were studied; a differential diagnosis of recurrent processes and postoperative changes at the site of intervention was made
